title: Watch: “Freedom from Maoist terror is near”: PM Modi’s Diwali message from INS Vikrant
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Diwali with naval personnel aboard INS Vikrant off the Goa coast. He praised the aircraft carrier as a symbol of ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ and lauded India’s armed forces. Addressing sailors, Modi said the country is on the verge of eradicating Maoist terror, with over 100 districts now free from its influence.

title: Sabarimala gold ‘theft’: SIT to submit first progress report to Kerala HC

title: Bihar Assembly polls: RJD releases list of 143 candidates, 24 of them are women

title: IMD issues 'cyclone alert' in Andaman & Nicobar Islands
content: “Local port warnings have been issued in the wake of the weather system, which is likely to cause heavy rainfall till October 23,” officials said

title: Police constable’s killer Riyaz shot dead in police encounter at Nizamabad hospital
content: Riyaz, who was taken into custody on October 19, had been wanted in connection with the murder of 42-year-old constable Pramod, who was stabbed to death while escorting him to a police station in Nizamabad on October 18

title: Early northeast monsoon onset creates ‘triple whammy’ in South India

content: According to the police, the Janshakti Janta Dal chief used an SUV, bearing a police logo and a beacon light, during a procession for submitting his documents in Mahua

title: PM Modi celebrates Deepavali aboard INS Vikrant, hails armed forces’ unity in Operation Sindoor
content: INS Vikrant is not just a warship but is a testimony to 21st-century India's hard work, talent, impact and commitment, Mr. Modi said

title: India’s jet-lagged fighter fleet
content: Over the last decade, the Indian Air Force has been asking for a new generation of fighter jets. With the MiG-21 now decommissioned, the number of squadrons that fly fighter jets is 70% lower than the sanctioned strength. Delay in indigenous manufacture and international procurement is the reason behind the ‘immediate gap’

title: Better future for India in medicine means embracing immunology today
content: The strength of Indian medicine has traditionally been its clinical acumen and ability to manage vast numbers of patients. However, to truly participate in and benefit from the coming age of immuno-medicine, a robust foundation in immunology education is not a luxury: it’s an urgent necessity

title: Both YSRCP and TDP are equally destructive forces, alleges Congress leader Thulasi Reddy
content: While the YSRCP government left the State buried in debt, crime, liquor, drugs, and cannabis, the coalition government made things worse by taking record loans of ₹1.5 lakh crore in 16 months and burdening electricity users with ₹15,480 crore in surcharges

title: Container Road still a death trap for motorists
content: Traffic congestion on Goshree bridges, lack of adequate streetlights and alleged unscientific road and junction designs are cited by local people as major causes behind accidents on Container Terminal Road

title: TNSDA completes the first phase of underwater survey off the Poompuhar coast
content: A team of 10 divers carried out the survey, which began on September 20 and continued for 12 days. The department is planning one more phase of exploration when the sea conditions are favourable

title: Karnataka invites ETH Zurich’s quantum pioneer to next Quantum India Summit in Bengaluru
content: The State government has deepened its international scientific engagement with ETH Zurich — one of the world’s leading institutions in quantum science and technology — through a visit to the ETH Quantum Center and an invitation for its leadership to participate in the Quantum India Summit 2026 in Bengaluru.

title: Trinamool leaders follow Abhishek, donate for flood relief in North Bengal
content: The WB government has sought donations under West Bengal State Disaster Management Authority (WBSDMA) Fund for flood relief. Abhishek Banerjee donated ₹1 lakh for flood relief, calling upon everyone to rise to the occasion and help rebuild shattered lives.

title: NC, PDP, BJP field members of the Shia clergy for J&K Assembly bypolls
content: This is the first time that Budgam, which has a sizable Shia population, will see three candidates from the Shia clergy contesting the by-polls

title: DGP appointment row: second contempt petition moved against Tamil Nadu government
content: In his petition, Madurai-based rights activist Henri Tiphagne says the action of the State was violative of the guidelines laid down by the Supreme Court in the Prakash Singh case

title: Mullaperiyar dam opened; Idukki and Theni face rain havoc
content: Man killed as intense overnight rain inundates roads and homes, triggers mudslides in Idukki; Tamil Nadu’s Theni district bordering Idukki too bore brunt of downpour; farmer dies in Virudhunagar after being washed away on flooded causeway

title: West Bengal BJP leader labels protesters ‘Bangladeshis who will be expelled in SIR’
content: The Nandigram BJP MLA who has been drumming up support for the Special Intensive Revision said that names of the ‘Bangladeshi Muslims’ who were behind the attack on his vehicle will be removed from the voter list after the SIR

title: Do cash transfers build women’s agency in India?
content: There is a need to ensure that women do not only receive money but also control, grow, and sustain it for their own advancement

title: 146 species recorded in Kaziranga bird survey
content: The avian count timed with Kati Bihu was conducted across five key locations of the Kaziranga National Park and the adjoining Laokhowa Wildlife Sanctuary

title: Bihar Assembly polls: PM Modi to launch election campaign from Karpoorigram
content: Bihar BJP State president Dilip Jaiswal said that PM would address an election rally in Begusarai on October 24

title: Low-pressure area likely over southeast Bay of Bengal by October 21: RMC
content: Under its influence, enhanced rainfall activity is likely over north Tamil Nadu and Puducherry between October 22 and 24

title: Fronts without faces: grand alliance, NDA reluctant to name CM candidate

title: Dynasts matter when it comes to Bihar elections, list of parties full of politicians' kin
content: Experts say that no party in Bihar can claim moral superiority on this ground as far as dynasts entering politics is concerned

title: Giriraj Singh’s remarks against Muslims trigger political row in Bihar

title: MiG 29 Take-Offs, Patriotic Songs, Yoga: PM Modi's Diwali On-Board INS Vikrant
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in a departure from earlier Diwalis where he spent time with the army on inhospitable zones, has spent the night on warship INS Vikrant, where he had an extensive set of engagements.

title: Eviction Notice After 70 Years, Diwali Goes Dark In Bhopal Slum
content: As India celebrates Diwali with homes shimmering in gold and markets echoing with laughter, there lies a patch of darkness behind Manas Bhavan in the heart of Bhopal.

title: Actor Pawan Singh's Wife Jyoti Singh Files Nomination From Karakat
content: Jyoti Singh, wife of Bhojpuri actor Pawan Singh, filed her nomination as an Independent candidate today from the Karakat Assembly constituency.

title: On Camera, Louvre Museum Thieves Seen Cutting Glass During Heist
content: Security cameras captured one of the thieves, dressed in construction gear, cutting through a glass display case while visitors walked nearby.

title: From Dubai Ruler To Australia PM, How World Leaders Wished Indians On Diwali
content: World leaders and foreign ambassadors extended wishes on the occasion of Diwali, the festival of lights, which is being celebrated by Indians across the world with pomp and gaiety.

title: "Nothing Called Friendly Fight": Chirag Paswan's Dig After RJD's Bihar List
content: Taking a swipe at the Opposition's Grand Alliance in Bihar, Union Minister Chirag Paswan today said there are no "friendly fights" in politics and said the INDIA bloc has given a walkover to NDA on many seats.

title: In RJD's Bihar Candidates List, Signs Of Tussle With Ally Congress
content: With two weeks to go for the Bihar Assembly election, the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has released a list of 143 candidates for the upcoming polls

title: Many Websites, Apps Go Dark As Amazon's Cloud Unit Reports Global Outage
content: AI startup Perplexity, cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase and trading app Robinhood attributed the outages to AWS.

title: "We Failed": France's Minister Says Louvre Museum Heist Hit Country's Image
content: French Justice Minister Gerard Darmanin said on Monday the jewelry heist at the Louvre museum on Sunday gave a very negative image of France as it implied a failure of security services.

title: From Kargil To Karwar: A Look At PM Modi's Annual Diwali Visits
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has continued his annual tradition of celebrating Diwali with India's armed forces, spending this year's festival of lights with Navy personnel onboard INS Vikrant, off the coasts of Goa and Karwar (Karnataka), on Monday.

title: Bengaluru Ola Engineer Dies By Suicide, Case Filed Against Bhavish Aggarwal
content: According to officials, K Aravind, who had been working as a homologation engineer since 2022 at Ola, consumed poison on September 28.

title: Ola Moves High Court After Employee's Suicide Note Alleges Exploitation
content: Ola Electric has moved the Karnataka High Court challenging a First Information Report (FIR) against the company over the suicide of a 38-year-old employee, allegedly due to mental harassment and financial exploitation.

title: North America's Tallest Lord Ram Statue At 51-Feet, Unveiled In Canada
content: A 51-foot-tall statue of Lord Rama has been installed in Mississauga, Canada, making it the tallest structure dedicated to the deity in North America.

title: All About Durand Line, Afghan-Pak Border That Kabul Refuses To Recognise
content: Following the Afghanistan-Pakistan peace talks in Doha, the Taliban's Defence Minister, Mohammad Yaqoob Mujahid, accused Pakistan of creating a false narrative about the Durand Line-- the international boundary line between both nations.

title: Lalu Prasad's Elder Son Tej Pratap Charged Over Poll Code Violation
content: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad's elder son and Janshakti Janta Dal chief Tej Pratap Yadav has been booked for allegedly violating the model code of conduct.

title: Tim Cook Shares Diwali Wishes, Features Mumbai Photographer's Stunning Shot
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook on Monday extended Diwali greetings to millions of people celebrating the festival of lights across the world, along with sharing an image taken by an Indian photographer with the new iPhone 17 Pro Max.

title: Thane Woman Killed, Man Injured As Vehicle Hits Bike In Hit-And-Run
content: A woman was killed and a man suffered injuries when an unidentified vehicle knocked down their motorbike in Maharashtra's Thane city, police said on Monday.

title: J&K Lt Governor Brings Back Holy Relics Of Lord Buddha From Russia
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha returned to India with the Holy Relics of Lord Buddha following their exposition in Kalmykia, Russia.

title: 23 Indians Rescued After Explosion Aboard LPG Tanker Off Yemen Coast
content: A total of 23 Indian crew members have been rescued after a fire broke out onboard the Cameroon-flagged LPG tanker MV Falcon, following an explosion, off the coast of Aden, Yemen.

title: PM Modi to face Quad, BRICS leaders at ASEAN meet next week

title: IT Minister Lokesh exhorts Telugu diaspora in Australia to join efforts to rebuild Andhra Pradesh

title: Four killed in a blast at a house in Avadi where country-made firecrackers were stored
content: The house on Vivasaya Street at Thandurai near Pattabhiram  also functioned as a shop selling country-made firecrackers. The concrete roof and a few other portions of the house collapsed in the explosion that occurred around 3 p.m.

title: Thiruvananthapuram gears up for Kerala School Sports Meet
content: Event will be held across 12 venues from October 21 to 28. Nearly 20,000 athletes, including participants from inclusive sports categories, will compete

title: Watch: Chirag Paswan: The art of the deal | Talking Politics
content: Both the BJP and JD(U) have been allocated 101 seats each, while the Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) led by Upendra Kushwaha and the Hindustani Awam Morcha (Secular) led by Union Minister Jitan Ram Manjhi have been allocated six seats each. Mr. Paswan also took a dig at the INDIA bloc, known as ‘Mahagathbandhan’ in Bihar, claiming that “there is so much infighting among the Opposition alliance partners”.

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Denied ticket to contest, candidates allege demands for money in the INDIA bloc
content: Congress’s Mohammad Afaque Alam’s demanded an investigation by Rahul Gandhi; the RJD’s Madan Prasad protested outside former CM Rabri Devi’s residence, and Ritu Jaiswal said she would contest as an independent candidate

title: Plan to privatise medical education and healthcare through PPP violates constitutional right to life, says former IAS officer P.V. Ramesh
content: He accuses the Andhra Pradesh government of using financial constraints as a pretext to divert pubic assets to its associates

title: RSS route march in Chittapur: Karnataka High Court directs Kalaburagi district administration to give report indicating action taken in according permission for November 2 pathasanchalana
content: The High Court of Karnataka, in a special sitting on Sunday, directed the Kalaburagi district administration to submit a report by October 24 indicating the action taken in according permission for the revised proposal of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) to hold pathasanhalana (route march) in Chittapur on November 2 instead of October 19, as was proposed earlier.

title: National lighting workshop illuminates Sangeetha Nataka Akademi
content: As many as 25 participants from across India participate in the workshop, which will conclude on October 24

title: Four districts in Kerala have recurrent summer water stress, says CWRDM study
content: As much as 24.74% of the wards in Kasaragod, 22.01% in Thiruvananthapuram, 20.72% in Pathanamthitta, and 20.48% in Kozhikode are experiencing water shortage in summer months

title: It is the INDIA bloc, not just MVA, which must decide on any new alliance partner in Maharashtra: State Congress chief

title: MNS chief Raj Thackeray claims 96 lakh fake voters in Maharashtra, demands poll roll overhaul
content: The MNS chief demanded a complete clean-up of voters’ list before any polls are held, calling the alleged manipulation a “mockery of democracy”

title: Garbage dumped under metro pillars turns Bannerghatta Road stretch into stinking blackspot

content: The six-week pre-incubation initiative of the Ratan Tata Innovation Hub is aimed at guiding aspiring entrepreneurs in minimising start-up risks, while preparing them for full-scale incubation and market entry

title: SCR Vijayawada Division collects record ₹1.22 crore in ticket checking drive

title: From zero to 33: How the Broncos pulled off an unlikely fourth-quarter comeback win
content: The Broncos went from being shut out for three quarters to scoring 33 in the fourth for a win that won't be forgotten.

title: Yesavage dominates M's as Jays force Game 7
content: Rookie starter Trey Yesavage continued his headline-grabbing postseason run Sunday night, striking out seven across 5⅔ innings, as the Toronto Blue Jays forced a Game 7 in the American League Championship Series by defeating the Seattle Mariners 6-2.

title: QB Daniels set for MRI after exit due to hamstring
content: Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels suffered a right hamstring injury early in the third quarter against the Dallas Cowboys on Sunday and was later ruled out, yet another blow to a banged-up Washington offense.

title: Broncos marvel at historic rally: 'Always a way'
content: Shut out for three quarters, the Broncos rallied with 33 points in the fourth to beat the Giants on Sunday in one of the most stunning turnarounds in NFL history.

title: CMC's latest do-it-all effort has Kittle's goal on track
content: Christian McCaffrey totaled 201 yards from scrimmage to lead the 49ers past the Falcons on Sunday night, and in doing so, he continued to etch his name in both franchise and league record books when it comes to all-purpose production.

title: RB Martin, former All-Pro with Bucs, dies at 36
content: Doug Martin, a former Boise State star who went on to be an All-Pro running back for the Buccaneers, has died, his family said in a statement Sunday. He was 36.

title: Vikes' Hockenson livid after replay overturns TD
content: T.J. Hockenson was livid Sunday when NFL replay overturned a fourth-quarter touchdown catch that would have closed the Philadelphia Eagles' lead to two points in the Vikings' eventual 28-22 loss.

title: Beamer calls S.C. 'dream job' amid Hokies chatter
content: South Carolina coach Shane Beamer pushed back Sunday about being rumored as a candidate for Virginia Tech's vacancy, saying he's in his "dream job" with the Gamecocks.

title: Lakers' Hayes keen to play for Slovenia with Luka
content: Jaxson Hayes, lamenting USA Basketball's lack of open tryouts, is keen to play with Lakers teammate Luka Doncic on the Slovenian national team, which allows one naturalized citizen on its roster for international competitions.

content: Sanders, who suffered a heart attack last year, is helping Detroit's running backs raise their game through his advice and example.

content: Tampa Bay played without its top four WRs and top RB last week and still found a way to improve to 5-1.

content: The Seahawks have been near flawless on the road under Mike Macdonald but still struggle to win at home.

content: Houston scored a combined 70 points in its past two games using DeMeco Ryans' motivation to keep football fun.

content: Man United's win at Anfield on Sunday was the best of the Ruben Amorim era, and it also marked Liverpool's fourth straight defeat in all competitions.

content: The stars strutted in their arrivals to the pregame tunnels in looks that match their personal style.

content: The code is written. The simulations run. Here's who BPI projects to be in the top six in each conference, those fighting for play-in spots and three teams with high-variance young prospects.

title: Briscoe secures spot in NASCAR playoff finale
content: Chase Briscoe, driving the No. 19 Bass Pro Shops Toyota, gave Joe Gibbs Racing its second spot in NASCAR's championship-deciding season finale with an overtime victory Sunday afternoon at Talladega Superspeedway, his first career win at the famous venue.

content: We awarded nontraditional superlatives to programs, players and performances from across Week 8 of the 2025 college football season.

content: Mike Vrabel and the Patriots were one of seven favorites to win outright in the early Week 7 NFL slate.

content: Marta's was in fine form on Saturday, helping Orlando beat Washington 3-2 and catapult the Pride up ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Marseille could offer Endrick a Madrid escape
content: Endrick hasn't played a minute for Madrid this season, and Marseille are ready to offer him an exit. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: Here's how the winter looks in Milwaukee -- and in the other towns whose teams lost their final postseason game.

title: 'It all turned so bad so fast': Inside James Franklin's Penn State departure
content: Penn State entered the season with national title aspirations. Six games in, the school fired its coach.

title: Two killed in bus pile-up near Malavalli
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Banke Bihari toshkhana survey: Gold, silver bars, gemstones found; treasure rooms locked since 1971
content: For the first time in 54 years, treasure rooms of Mathura's Banke Bihari temple were reopened, revealing gold and silver bars, gemstones, and precious coins. The Supreme Court-appointed panel is set to assess and decide on the preservation of these historical finds, which were documented and sealed again.

title: Viral video: Surat teen booked for assaulting cop during raid; bizman father held
content: A businessman's son, Jainam Shah, faces charges for assaulting a police officer during a raid on a birthday party where liquor was allegedly served. The incident, captured on video, led to Jainam's booking under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita. His father, Samir Shah, was previously arrested for liquor possession at the same event.

title: India-US trade takes a hit amid tariff row; exports fall 37.5% in four months: Report
content: India's exports to the US have plummeted by 20.3% in September 2025, reaching $5.5 billion, due to Washington's imposition of 50% tariffs. This marks the fourth consecutive monthly decline, erasing over $3.3 billion in trade since May. Key sectors like textiles and gems and jewellery are severely impacted.

title: Dinner, songs, yoga & more: How PM Modi spent Diwali with Navy on INS Vikrant
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Diwali with Indian naval personnel aboard the indigenously built aircraft carrier INS Vikrant. He witnessed an impressive air power demonstration and interacted with officers and sailors. The Prime Minister emphasized the importance of self-reliance and lauded the courage of the Navy. This visit continues his annual tradition of celebrating Diwali with the armed forces.

title: Diwali 2025: 85+ heartfelt wishes, greetings, messages, and quotes
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, celebrates Lord Ram's return and the triumph of good over evil. Homes glow with diyas and rangolis, filled with sweets and laughter. Beyond its mythology, Diwali signifies dispelling ignorance with knowledge and hatred with love. It's a time for gratitude, forgiveness, and new beginnings, with families uniting and prayers for prosperity.

title: Bengaluru techie suicide case: Ola CEO booked; family questions mysterious bank transfer
content: An Ola Electric engineer's alleged suicide has led to a criminal case against CEO Bhavish Aggarwal and others. A note reportedly details workplace harassment and mental pressure. The family's suspicion was raised by a large bank transfer post-death, with the company allegedly failing to provide clear answers. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Bihar polls: RJD's list of 143 names exposes cracks in MGB; Tejashwi gets Raghopur
content: Bihar's RJD announced its 143 candidates for the upcoming assembly elections, asserting its dominance in the Mahagathbandhan despite internal tensions. The party aims to unseat chief minister Nitish Kumar, with Tejashwi Yadav's political future at stake. The alliance faces challenges with overlapping candidacies and ambiguity over a chief ministerial face.

title: 'True sweetness of Diwali': Rahul makes 'imarti' at iconic Delhi shop - watch
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited Delhi's historic Ghantewala sweet shop, trying his hand at making imarti. The shop owner recalled serving the Gandhi family for generations. Gandhi shared a video of the visit on Diwali, emphasizing the sweetness of relationships and community.

title: Diwali 2025: Google CEO Sundar Pichai shares wishes with photo of ‘Barfi plate’
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai shared a festive Diwali post on Instagram, humorously arranging barfi in the shape of the Google logo. Meanwhile, Google Search offers an interactive surprise for Diwali searches, featuring a virtual mandir with Goddess Lakshmi and celebratory animations, honoring the festival's spiritual core.

title: China borrowed US playbook and is now hitting back at its trade games
content: China is now using American trade tactics. Beijing requires foreign firms to get government approval to export magnets with Chinese rare earth materials. This move mirrors a US policy used to restrict China's access to technology. China is learning from past trade wars and has created its own 'unreliable entity list' and anti-sanction laws.

title: Panic at 36,000 feet: Boeing 737’s windshield cracks mid-air; space debris to blame?
content: A United Airlines pilot sustained injuries after a mystery object struck a Boeing 737's windshield at high altitude. The aircraft made an emergency landing in Salt Lake City. Photos show the pilot's injuries and cockpit damage. Experts are investigating the unusual incident, which has raised concerns about space debris. The flight was en route from Denver to Los Angeles.

title: After going for AI agents, laying off 4K employees; Salesforce CEO says: AI doesn't have a soul
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff is sending mixed signals on AI's workplace impact. While the company replaced 4,000 customer support roles with AI agents, Benioff claims AI lacks the human touch essential for sales. Despite these cuts, Salesforce is hiring thousands of new salespeople, highlighting a strategic division of AI's application.

title: Delhi pollution alert: Air quality ‘very poor’ on eve of Diwali; Grap-2 imposed
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category ahead of Diwali, triggering Stage 2 of the Graded Response Action Plan. Restrictions on DG sets and interstate buses are now in effect. Experts predict a further decline to 'severe' levels by Tuesday due to Diwali fireworks and unfavorable weather, with toxic air expected to persist all week.

title: Diwali Puja guide: Muhurat, vidhi & mantras- Check how to perform
content: Diwali 2025 falls on Monday, October 20, with Lakshmi Puja ideally conducted during Pradosh Kaal (5:46 PM - 8:18 PM IST) on the Amavasya night. The festival emphasizes the triumph of light over darkness, involving home cleaning, vibrant decorations, and specific rituals to invite Goddess Lakshmi for prosperity and wealth.

title: 'INS Vikrant sent waves of fear across Pak': PM Modi celebrates Diwali with Navy — Key takeaways
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Diwali with naval personnel aboard the INS Vikrant, highlighting their courage and dedication. He emphasized the aircraft carrier's significance as a symbol of 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' and India's growing defence prowess. PM Modi conveyed Diwali wishes to the soldiers and their families, calling them his own.

title: Lauren Kyle turns heads in chic NYC night out as McDavid hits road
content: While Connor McDavid's Oilers faced a tough loss in New York, his wife Lauren Kyle captivated fans with a glamorous girls' night out. Sharing stylish moments on Instagram, she showcased elegance and city sophistication, enjoying espresso martinis with friends. Her vibrant presence off the ice highlights the dynamic lives of NHL partners.

title: Christian McCaffrey defends Olivia Culpo, says their love is built on respect
content: Former Miss Universe Olivia Culpo and San Francisco Forty-Niners star Christian McCaffrey have welcomed their first child. Daughter Colette Annalise was born in July 2025. Their journey began with social media interactions in 2019. They married in Rhode Island in June 2024. This new parenthood marks a significant milestone for the couple.

title: NBA trade rumor: Celtics eye $186M Bucks star to pair with Jayson Tatum
content: Boston Celtics may pursue Giannis Antetokounmpo if Jayson Tatum misses the 2025-26 season due to injury. A hypothetical trade involves sending Jaylen Brown and assets to Milwaukee for Giannis, Myles Turner, and Bobby Portis. This bold move could reshape both franchises, creating a new core for Boston and a rebuild for the Bucks.

title: Bihar polls: Nitish Kumar’s 10th CM bid – what’s at stake for the veteran JD(U) leader?
content: Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar is set for a significant electoral battle. He aims to retain his position with NDA support. This election is critical for his legacy and his party's standing. Voters will consider his governance record and potential political fatigue. The BJP's growing influence presents a new dynamic. The outcome will shape Bihar's political future.

title: Dhvani Bhanushali doesn’t do Diwali parties; ‘none of us know how to play cards’ - Exclusive
content: Singer Dhvani Bhanushali shares that Diwali for her family is about togetherness, not parties, as no one plays cards. Her fondest childhood memory is Padwa, and she indulges in festive delicacies a week prior. Bhanushali considers her parents, sister, and dog Liu the light of her life.

title: 'Disappointed': Ex-India cricketer slams Shubman’s leadership after India’s defeat
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut saw India lose to Australia by seven wickets in Perth. Batting faltered, and bowling lacked penetration, with Kuldeep Yadav's exclusion drawing criticism. Former player Mohammad Kaif questioned team selection and Gill's tactical decisions, highlighting the need for genuine wicket-takers over batting depth.

title: 'Putin will destroy you': Maps tossed, tempers flared — how Trump-Zelenskyy’s tense meeting unfolded
content: President Trump reportedly urged Ukrainian President Zelenskyy to accept Putin's terms to end the war, warning of destruction if Ukraine refused. During a contentious meeting, Trump discarded battlefield maps and echoed Russian talking points, ultimately declining to supply long-range missiles.

title: Dolphins name Quinn Ewers as Tua Tagovailoa’s backup for week 7 against Browns
content: The Miami Dolphins have named rookie Quinn Ewers as Tua Tagovailoa's backup for their Week 7 game against the Cleveland Browns, replacing Zach Wilson. This move signals confidence in Ewers' readiness and provides him an opportunity for his NFL debut in potentially challenging weather conditions. Zach Wilson has been demoted to third-string.

title: 'BGT nightmares return for Virat Kohli' – Ex-Indian cricketer issues bold verdict
content: India's ODI opener against Australia in Perth was a one-sided affair, with the top-order faltering in challenging conditions. Despite rain interruptions, KL Rahul and Axar Patel provided some resistance, but India could only manage 136 for 9. Former player Irfan Pathan highlighted batting struggles and suggested early acclimatization for future tours.

title: Diwali bank holidays 2025: When will banks be closed? Check state-wise schedule
content: Diwali celebrations in October 2025 will bring several bank holidays across India. Different states will observe closures on various days for festivals like Naraka Chaturdashi, Laxmi Puja, Govardhan Puja, and Bhai Dooj. Some regions will experience extended breaks. Customers can use digital banking services during these periods. Planning transactions in advance is recommended.

title: Maharashtra: 100 robotic sewer cleaners to be bought for Rs 100cr; manual scavenging to end
content: Maharashtra is revolutionizing its approach to sanitation with a groundbreaking investment of Rs 100 crore in 100 robotic sewer-cleaning machines. This forward-thinking initiative, named 'From Manhole to Machine Hole,' seeks to replace perilous manual work with cutting-edge technology.

title: 'India will keep paying tariffs if ...': Trump's warning on Russian oil; repeats 'spoke to PM Modi' claim
content: US President  Donald Trump has once again warned India of "massive" tariffs if it continues to purchase Russian oil, claiming Prime Minister Modi personally assured him of a halt. Earlier, the ministry of external affairs has rejected these remarks, stating its energy policy prioritizes consumer interests and stable, secure supplies through diversified sourcing.

title: Tariff war: Trump says he’s ‘not looking to hurt China’; lists key demands
content: President Trump indicated a willingness to reduce tariffs on Chinese goods if Beijing agrees to concessions, including increased soybean purchases and halting rare earth mineral restrictions. These remarks follow the US's announcement of an additional 100% tariff on Chinese imports, escalating trade tensions ahead of fresh negotiations.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ album faces backlash- check why
content: Taylor Swift's new album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' is sparking debate over lyrics perceived to have racial undertones and potential digs at Travis Kelce's ex, Kayla Nicole. Critics also point to "trad wife" themes, raising concerns about conservative undertones and the impact of her public narrative on discussions of identity and power.

title: ‘Thamma’ first review: Ayushmann, Nawazuddin-starrer called ‘entertainer’
content: Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna's horror-comedy 'Thamma' is generating significant buzz ahead of its October 21, 2025 release. Film critic Taran Adarsh awarded it four stars, calling it a "well-packaged entertainer" with a novel plot inspired by Indian folklore. The film promises unexpected twists, humor, and strong performances from its lead cast and Nawazuddin Siddiqui.

title: Canada tightens immigration rules: Nearly 2k Indians deported; careers at risk
content: Canada is witnessing a sharp rise in deportations of Indian nationals, impacting professionals and students. Nearly 2,000 Indians were removed in 2024, with numbers escalating. This crackdown, driven by immigration reforms, creates uncertainty for work permits, study prospects, and post-study opportunities, urging vigilance and proactive planning for those in Canada.

title: IND vs AUS: 176.5 kmph! Did Starc bowl the fastest ball in ODI history?
content: Mitchell Starc's spell against India in the first ODI saw a sensational, albeit erroneous, 176.5 kmph delivery to Rohit Sharma. Both Sharma and Virat Kohli had disappointing outings, with Kohli dismissed for an eight-ball duck, marking his first in Australia. This loss ended India's eight-match winning streak in ODIs.

title: 'Govt is lying': AAP slams Delhi CM; challenges BJP leaders to drink Yamuna water if it’s clean
content: Delhi AAP unit President Saurabh Bharadwaj on Sunday slammed the Delhi government under the BJP over their claims of cleaning the Yamuna and challenged Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta and Minister Parvesh Verma to "drink a litre of Yamuna water" to prove their claims.

title: '96L fake voters added': Raj Thackeray urges EC to halt local body polls; oppn plan march
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray alleged the addition of 9.6 million fake voters, urging the Election Commission to postpone local body elections until the issue is resolved. Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut announced a meeting with election officials, joined by Uddhav Thackeray, Raj Thackeray, and Sharad Pawar, to address voter list discrepancies and alleged electoral irregularities.

title: Delhi horror: How unborn child led to stabbing tragedy; ex-live-in partner kills pregnant woman
content: A jilted lover, Aashu, fatally stabbed his former live-in partner Shalini and her husband Aakash in Delhi. Aakash, in self-defense, killed Aashu with the same knife. Shalini, who was pregnant, succumbed to her injuries, leaving behind two children and a grieving family.

title: Durgapur rape case: 2 accused file plea to confess; survivor says classmate molested her and fled
content: Two accused in the Durgapur gang-rape case, Sk Riyazuddin and Sk Safiq, have sought court permission to confess their involvement. The 23-year-old MBBS student was allegedly attacked after leaving campus. The court sent the accused to jail custody for two days to reconsider their plea. The survivor identified her classmate as one of the assailants.

title: Israel strikes Gaza again; fragile truce faces new test — 10 things to know
content: Gaza's fragile ceasefire faced its first major test as Israel launched airstrikes after accusing Hamas of killing two soldiers.  While the US insists the truce holds, "some shooting" by Hamas was acknowledged.  Mediators are working urgently to prevent renewed conflict amid mounting civilian casualties and a brief aid suspension.

title: Women's World Cup: Smriti breaks down, takes blame for India’s loss
content: Smriti Mandhana took responsibility for India’s heartbreaking four-run defeat to England in the Women’s ODI World Cup 2025, admitting her dismissal triggered the collapse from a dominant position. Despite strong knocks from Mandhana (88) and Harmanpreet Kaur (70), India faltered late in the chase, jeopardizing their semifinal hopes ahead of must-win games against New Zealand and Bangladesh.

title: Louvre museum heist: What ‘priceless’ jewels were stolen in Paris?
content: In a brazen daylight heist, thieves stole eight priceless jewels, including crown jewels linked to French queens and empresses, from the Louvre Museum. The sophisticated operation, involving four disguised individuals, lasted only minutes, with the thieves escaping on scooters. Authorities are investigating the theft, which has left the historic collection significantly diminished.

title: China’s Q3 GDP growth slows to lowest in a year — Key points
content: China's economy experienced its weakest pace in a year, growing less than 5% due to sluggish domestic demand and US trade tensions. While exports and industrial production showed strength, a significant drop in fixed-asset and property investment, alongside weak retail sales, weighed down overall growth.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 soars past 25,900 on Diwali; BSE Sensex up over 600 points
content: Stock market today: The NSE Nifty advanced by 133.30 points or 0.52 per cent, closing at 25,843.15. The BSE Sensex concluded at 84,363.37, rising by 411.18 points or 0.49 per cent. During trading hours, it reached a peak of 84,656.56, gaining 704.37 points or 0.83 per cent.

title: India adds record MBBS seats: Total reaches 1.37L; check state-wise distribution
content: India's medical education is transforming with a historic increase in MBBS seats and new colleges. The National Medical Commission is spearheading this expansion to boost healthcare access and train more doctors. This move is set to significantly enhance medical education infrastructure across the nation.  The country is on track to meet its ambitious targets for medical seat additions.

title: Virat Kohli steps aside, pushes Shubman Gill and Shreyas Iyer to walk first - watch
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma made their return to the Indian ODI side in Perth, but both experienced disappointing outings. Kohli was dismissed for a duck, caught by Cooper Connolly off Mitchell Starc, while Sharma's 500th international match ended with him scoring just eight runs, caught by Matthew Renshaw off Josh Hazlewood.

title: IndiGo flight fire scare: Passenger power bank catches fire at Delhi airport; crew douses flames
content: A passenger's power bank ignited on an IndiGo flight bound for Dimapur while taxiing at Delhi airport on Sunday. Cabin crew swiftly extinguished the fire, ensuring no injuries. The aircraft underwent checks and was cleared for operation after relevant authorities were informed.

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 8: Big move for Bama
content: the 13 members of the college football playoff selection committee will meet for two days . they're going to meet at the Gaylord Texan Resort in Grapevine, Texas . the committee will do their own mock ranking to help the new members better understand the process .
